intro: Eccoilopus hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's star moss, is a species of liverwort found in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its dense, star-shaped growth pattern. The plant has a thalloid structure with a flat, ribbon-like body covered in small, leaf-like structures called phyllidia. It thrives in cool, humid climates and is often found on rocks or tree trunks in forested areas. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists studying bryophyte ecology.
